title: Osmanabadi Goat
description: Osmanabadi goats are native to the Osmanabad district of Maharashtra and are known for their high resistance to diseases and good meat quality.

title: Sangamneri Goat
description: Sangamneri goats are a dual-purpose breed, popular for both milk and meat production, and are found in the Ahmednagar district of Maharashtra.

title: Surti Goat
description: Surti goats are primarily found in the regions of Maharashtra and Gujarat, known for their high milk yield and adaptability.

title: Khillar Goat
description: Khillar goats are native to the Solapur and Satara districts of Maharashtra, known for their hardiness and good meat production.

title: Barbari Goat
description: Barbari goats, though originating from Uttar Pradesh, are also popular in Maharashtra for their prolific breeding and good meat quality.

title: Berari Goat
description: Berari goats, also known as Tapti goats, are found in the Vidarbha region of Maharashtra and are valued for their good milk production.

title: Ganjam Goat
description: Ganjam goats, native to Odisha, are also reared in Maharashtra for their excellent meat quality and high disease resistance.

title: Konkan Kanyal Goat
description: Konkan Kanyal goats are indigenous to the Konkan region of Maharashtra, known for their good meat quality and adaptability to coastal conditions.

title: Deccani Goat
description: Deccani goats, native to the Deccan plateau, are well-adapted to the arid conditions of Maharashtra and are known for their meat and milk production.

title: Malabari Goat
description: Malabari goats, although primarily from Kerala, are also found in Maharashtra. They are known for their high fertility and good milk yield.
